decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through a mix of counterspells, removal, and land disruption while ramping up to powerful threats like Omnath and Uro. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage and ramping into powerful late-game threats. By utilizing a combination of control elements, card advantage engines, and versatile threats, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a longer game.

The deck aims to quickly and efficiently assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to win the game, avoiding any potential loss of life. Thassa's Oracle is used as an alternate win condition if needed. The deck utilizes cards like Spoils of the Vault and Pact of Negation to protect the combo and ensure its success. The mana base includes various mana-fixing lands to support the combo pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around assembling the combo pieces quickly and effectively to secure a win in the Modern format.

The deck revolves around utilizing Amulet of Vigor to generate additional mana and cast Primeval Titan as quickly as possible. By comboing with lands such as Vesuva, Valakut, and Castle Garenbrig, the deck can create powerful board states and quickly overwhelm the opponent with large threats. The inclusion of Dryad of the Ilysian Grove and Turntimber Symbiosis helps ensure consistent land drops and access to key cards, while Engineered Explosives provides additional removal options. Overall, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and achieve victory through explosive plays and overwhelming its opponent.

This deck focuses on playing multiple Spirit creatures in quick succession to apply pressure on the opponent and control the board. It utilizes cards like Aether Vial and Collected Company to quickly put creatures onto the battlefield, while also having disruptive spirits like Spell Queller and Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of evasive creatures and disruptive spells, while also having some ways to generate additional creatures or card advantage.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with low-cost creatures and utilizing tribal synergy to overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes cards like Supreme Phantom and Drogskol Captain to boost the power of the spirits, while cards like Collected Company allow for quick creature deployment. The mana base includes a mix of lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells. By leveraging the spirit tribe's abilities and evasiveness, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through aggressive creature-based combat.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a board presence of aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Kiln Fiend, and Stormwing Entity, while using low-cost spells such as Lightning Bolt, Crash Through, and Lava Dart to clear the way for attacks and boost their power. The deck also includes cards like Opt and Manamorphose to help maintain card advantage and consistency. Overall, this deck focuses on swift, aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent and win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on creating an infinite loop by using the combo of Felidar Guardian and Saheeli Rai to copy the Guardian an infinite number of times. This combo allows for rapid generation of creature tokens and triggers various effects from cards like Omnath, Locus of Creation and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the overall strategy and ensure consistent casting of the combo pieces.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and put into play using various spells like Chord of Calling, Eladamri's Call, and Finale of Devastation. By combining Devoted Druid with Vizier of Remedies, the deck can generate infinite mana and potentially infinite creatures, allowing for a powerful combo finish. The inclusion of cards like Postmortem Lunge and Lurrus of the Dream-Den adds resilience and recursion to the deck, while cards like Giver of Runes offer protection for key combo pieces.

This deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence through the use of Goblin creatures. By utilizing cards like Krenko, Mob Boss, Goblin Chieftain, and Goblin Ringleader, the deck is able to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a horde of creatures. Support cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls ensure that goblins can be played efficiently and without interruption. The deck also includes some utility cards like Goblin Cratermaker and Munitions Expert to deal with opposing threats. The strategy is to flood the board with goblins and push for a quick victory.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Gruul Spellbreaker to deal quick damage to your opponent. The deck also includes versatile cards like Lightning Bolt and Wrenn and Six to control the board and keep the pressure on. With a mix of creatures, removal spells, and mana ramp, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early on and secure a swift victory.

The key concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan with cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben while applying pressure with aggro creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Skyclave Apparition. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and land destruction to hinder the opponent's mana base, this deck aims to control the battlefield and create advantageous board states. With the ability to quickly close out games with equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice, this deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Human creature type to create a fast and aggressive board presence, leveraging synergies between Humans and providing disruption to the opponent's strategy through cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with a swarm of powerful Human creatures and maintain its advantage throughout the game.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger, along with disruption and removal spells such as Inquisition of Kozilek and Fatal Push to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck also includes powerful Planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six to control the board and generate advantage. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the three-color mana requirements of the deck, allowing for a consistent and aggressive gameplan.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also utilizing aggressive creatures like Lightning Skelemental and Seasoned Pyromancer to quickly reduce your opponent's life total. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to clear the way for your creatures to attack. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and control, while cards like Dark Confidant and Magmatic Channeler provide card advantage and help maintain pressure on your opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost aggro creatures and efficiently using spells to deal direct damage to the opponent, aiming to win the game quickly by overwhelming the opponent with damage. Key cards include Monastery Swiftspear, Stormwing Entity, and Soul-Scar Mage, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. The deck also utilizes card draw and mana fixing through cards like Manamorphose and Light Up the Stage to ensure consistent aggression and pressure on the opponent.
